articles.author: Ashley Carman
articles.title: Google is expanding its Project Fi phone lineup with the LG G7, V35, and Moto G6
articles.description: Google’s Project Fi cellular service now supports the LG G7 ThinQ, LG V35 ThinQ, and Motorola’s Moto G6.

articles.author: Andrew Webster
articles.title: Bethesda teases Fallout 76 ahead of E3
articles.description: Bethesda is returning to the wasteland. Ahead of E3, the developer officially announced Fallout 76 — though we don’t know much about the game aside from the name.

articles.author: Dieter Bohn
articles.title: A better metaphor for technology
articles.description: Think of tech as an instrument, not a tool

articles.author: Chris Welch
articles.title: Google reportedly planning Pixel 3 for October, and the XL model will have a notch
articles.description: The Pixel 3 and Pixel 3 XL will reportedly debut in October and retain Verizon as the exclusive US carrier. The Pixel 3 XL will reportedly have a notch at the top of its display like the iPhone X and many 2018 Android smartphones.

articles.author: Nilay Patel
articles.title: AT&T and Verizon want to run big ad-tracking networks to rival Facebook
articles.description: AT&T and Verizon want to run big ad-tracking networks to rival Facebook

articles.author: Jordan White
articles.title: Wolverine: The Long Night opens up the possibilities for a Marvel Podcast Universe
articles.description: The success of Marvel New Media’s 10-episode Wolverine series — Marvel’s first venture into scripted podcasting — suggests a promising future for a Marvel Podcast Universe.

articles.author: Casey Newton
articles.title: Why New York beats Silicon Valley as a destination for some  startups
articles.description: In the second episode of Converge with Casey Newton, Zola co-founder and CEO Shan-Lyn Ma tells us why New York is an ideal place to found a startup for new founders.

articles.author: Stefan Etienne
articles.title: New gaming laptops haven’t solved the battery life problem
articles.description: Asus, Digital Storm, and Gigabyte hexacore laptops get tested

articles.author: Rachel Becker
articles.title: Scientists have 3D printed the most advanced artificial cornea ever using human cells
articles.description: Scientists have 3D printed the thin protective film over the eye, the cornea, using human cells — and it’s the most advanced version of an artificial cornea yet. Should the technology improve, it could help millions of people see again.

articles.author: Shannon Liao
articles.title: The US is limiting visas for Chinese international students majoring in tech
articles.description: The US State Department announced yesterday it’s going to shorten the length of visas granted to Chinese citizens, a move to combat the supposed theft of US intellectual property.
